text: Question for you, Sir Odacchi! The buildings in Wano are rounded and warped and very full of character, but I must ask... Is that little roof over the sumo ring just... hanging in thin air?!

That's right. It's floating. Er, it's flying. It's a kite. When you see sumo events held indoors, they hang this tsuriyane roof over the ring from the ceiling above. But since the sumo in Bakura Town is outside, they fly it instead. It looks heavy, but it's actually very light. The part about it being a kite is kind of complicated, so just think of it as a kind of balloon!
Odacchi! I noticed something. In chapter 916, volume 91, when Luffy beats Yokozuna Urashima, one of the banners there reads "Mougan Ono-zeki." (Fierce
Rock Axe Sumo). Or should that be "Axe-Hand Morgan," like the character from chapter 4?! Is it possible that former Captain Morgan will appear in Wano?! Am I right about that?!

Wow, nice job! Yeah, that probably refers to Morgan. "Probably?" you ask? That's because my assistant staff draws the backgrounds, so that would be a case of my staff challenging the readers. Since this is Wano, an analogue for old-time Japan, there needs to be Japanese writing on the signs and such in the background, and it would be too much for me to give directions on every single little thing, so I tell them that if they need ideas for background text, to hide words and Easter eggs relating to One Piece in the background. There are others in that panel for Jango, Hyozo, and Marineford. I bet there's more in other panels too!
